translator_notes: This page continues the table of contents with chapters 21-47
「西厢记」(Romance of the Western Chamber) and「牡丹亭」(Peony Pavilion) are famous Chinese romantic dramas frequently referenced in the novel
「杨妃」refers to Yang Guifei (famous Tang dynasty beauty) - here used as a comparison for Xue Baochai
「飞燕」refers to Zhao Feiyan (famous Han dynasty beauty) - here comparing to Lin Daiyu in the famous 'Burial of Flowers' scene
「金兰」(Golden Orchid) refers to sworn sisterhood, a traditional bond between women
「蘅芜君」and「潇湘子」are poetic names for Xue Baochai and Lin Daiyu respectively
research_notes: Chapters 37-38 feature the famous poetry competitions that showcase the talents of the main female characters
Chapter 27 contains the famous 'Burial of Flowers' (葬花吟) scene, one of the most celebrated passages in Chinese literature
